page.title: 15LONG EATON. Tenements.
page.content: Within the half century 1864-1912 Long Eaton became a highly prosperious town. This was due in a large part to the growth of the Lace Industry. Traditionaly the industry was one of small firms. Many of these joined together to share large tenement factories. Many people were able to start their businesses with a limited amount of money, sharing the costs of overheads. Some were built by lace machine makers others by speculators unconnected by the trade, such as E.T.Hooley. The largest of these tenemnets are to be found in Leopold Street, where the factory on the eastern side of the street is 300m long, four floors high and built in the 1880's.
